item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Good people of New York, please join me November 14 at the 92nd St. Y, where I'll be talking on stage with Donald Johanson about the fiftieth anniversary of Lucy's discovery--and what we've learned about human evolution in the half-century since. Details here: https://www.92ny.org/event/dr-donald-johanson-and-carl-zimmer?mcSID=1031480

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Photo by Jason Kuffer https://flic.kr/p/6FAH6C

item.title: Carl T. Bergstrom
item.description: Taylorism is a management philosophy based on using scientific optimization to maximize labor productivity and economic efficiency. Here's the result of making the false Taylorist assumption that the output of scientific research is scientific papers‚Äîthe more, faster, and cheaper, the better.

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
For those who missed it: Ren√© Aquarius reports on his experience of trying to be a diligent reviewer for MDPI. Seems they don't like it, and find ways to publish the paper anyway.
http://deevybee.blogspot.com/2024/08/guest-post-my-experience-as-reviewer.html
Coupled with this trend, https://doi.org/10.1007/s11192-024-05125-w, suggests peer review is not working at #MDPI
#publishing #peerreview

item.title: The Transmitter
item.description: @DulacLab explains how reading widely shaped her worldview, and discusses the vomeronasal organ in this new episode of Synaptic. Listen now: By Brady Huggett https://www.thetransmitter.org/synaptic/male-and-female-brains-proust-and-catherine-dulac/?utm_source=mastodon&utm_medium=org-social&utm_campaign=20240801-synaptic-catherine-dulac

item.title: Kai Kupferschmidt
item.description:
WHO has just declared the rise in #mpox cases a public health emergency of international concern (#PHEIC). "The detection and rapid spread of a new clade of mpox in eastern DRC, its detection in neighboring countries that had not previously reported mpox, and the potential for further spread within Africa and beyond is very worrying",
WHO's director general Tedros said in the presser just now.

item.title: Electronic Frontier Foundation
item.description: EFF is back in court trying to make sure patent litigation is transparent as possible. https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2024/08/eff-presses-federal-circuit-make-patent-case-filings-public

item.title: Dan Gillmor
item.description: The latest test of journalism -- which our political press will surely fail -- is tomorrow's Trump "press conference" at another of his properties.Trump knows he can manipulate the media with impunity, because our media are begging to be manipulated.

item.title: The Conversation U.S.
item.description:
‚ÄúThe U.S. #SupremeCourt is deregulating corruption, with arguably grim consequences for American democracy.‚ÄùAnalysis by a professor of law who explains how SCOTUS is making it much harder for federal prosecutors to go after corrupt state and local officials:
https://theconversation.com/this-supreme-court-has-redefined-the-meaning-of-corruption-233424
#USPolitics #News #Law

item.title: Muir√©n N√≠S√≠dach
item.description:
If this were a pregnant white woman, there would be a firestorm of outrage coast to coast, even if she was armed and threatened the life of a police officer.But an unarmed, pregnant Black woman only "suspected" of a petty thief, and posing no threat is put down like a dangerous animal.This is not a few bad apples, or a police problem, it's the manufactured culture of #whiteness and the state-sponsored racial class system that cultivates and defends it.Ohio Cop Charged with Murdering 21-Year-Old Pregnant Black Mother Ta‚ÄôKiya Young
#BlackMastodon #whiteTerrorism #Police #StateViolence
https://www.democracynow.org/2024/8/14/headlines/ohio_cop_charged_with_murdering_21_year_old_pregnant_black_mother_takiya_young

item.title: Boris Barbour

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description:
My colleague Ben Mueller and I have new stories out this afternoon about intriguing new studies of the brain. Ben writes about an implant that allows someone with ALS to talk. I write about how a quarter of unresponsive people with brain injuries might actually capable of sustained cognition‚Äîand might benefit from those implants, too.
Gift links: Ben: https://nyti.ms/4cnatO5 Me: https://nyti.ms/4dntRfd
